required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: BAY86-9766 Plus Gemcitabine Phase I Study in Asian
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Phase Ib Study of MEK (Mitogen Activated Protein Kinase/ERK Kinase) Inhibitor BAY86-9766 Plus Gemcitabine in Asian Patients With Advanced or Refractory Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock:
This is an open-label, uncontrolled, Phase Ib study designed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of BAY86-9766 when given as a single agent and in combination with gemcitabine in Asian patients with advanced or refractory solid tumors.Blood samples for PK (pharmacokinetics) analyses will be collected after a single dose of BAY86-9766, multiple doses of BAY86-9766, and combination treatment of gemcitabine and BAY86-9766.
Safety evaluation will include adverse events assessment, vital signs, laboratory tests, 12-lead ECG ECG (electrocardiography), cardiac function test, and ophthalmologic examination at various time points during the study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 6 day

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration of M17 and M11
primary_outcome.time_frame: Multiple time points up to 6 day
Multiple time points up to 6 day
Multiple time points up to 6 day

primary_outcome.measure: Number of adverse events, or abnormal parameters as a measure of safety and tolerability
primary_outcome.description: Parameters are laboratory parameters, vital signs, ECG parameters, cardiac function, and parameters of ophthalmologic examinations

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of BAY86-9766 shown by a discrete scale
secondary_outcome.description: Elements of the scale are :Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), Stable Disease (SD) or Progressive Disease (PD)

arm_group.description: Single dose of BAY86-9766 on Cycle 1 Day -17; twice daily dosing every day starting on day -14, start dose 50mg bid ( 30mg or 20mg are possible based on adverse events need) in addition with Gemcitabine intravenous on day 1,8 and 15 1000mg/m2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female patients >/= 18 years of age, with histologically or cytologically documented advanced or refractory solid tumors not amenable to standard therapy
- Patients must have at least one measurable or evaluable tumor lesion according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1
- Patients must have a life expectancy of at least 12 weeks, and an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG PS) </=1.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of cardiac disease
- Active clinically serious infections > Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) grade 2
- Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection
- Uncontrolled seizure disorder
- Undergoing renal dialysis
- Known bleeding diathesis
- History of organ allograft
- Pregnant or breast feeding women
